Arbouin. Bratton. M. Henry de Breban, D. Cassamajor. Churchill. Cromwell, Hinchinbrooke, co. Hants; descended from Williams, Wales. The Lord Protector Oliver Cromwell. Cromwell, Thobalds, Cheshunt, co. Herts; the heiress m. 1831, Russell. Deverdon. Edgar, Wadderley, Scotland. Engharad, daughter of Meirich ap Dynfwal ap Arthen ap Sybsilt, King of Cardigan, and wife of Rhodri Mawr. (?) Silvester de Everdon, Bishop of Carlisle, 1247-54. Roger de everdon, seal 24 Edward III, Harl. MS. 818, fo. 43. Eble de genevre, B. Holmes. Lewis, Lanishen Court, co. Monmouth; quartering sa. a chev. betw. three spear-heads arg. with sa. a chev. bew. three fleurs-de-lis or, and or on a canton gu. two lions pass. of the first; and Lanishen House, co. Glamorgan; both descended through Lewis, the Van, co. Glamorgan, from Ivor ap Meurig, known as Ivor Bach, living temp. Hen. II; the heiress m. Windsor. Hall Essex. Hereford. Kilche. Sir Johan de Kindeston, (? the lion or), J Mackmorough, Ireland. Maithiard. Tobias Matthew, Bishop of Durham, 1595; Archbishop of York, 1606028; quartering gu. three chevronels arg. with a crescent in the fess point .... Matthew, co Dorset. Matthew, Stansted, Sussex. Modlicote, Whitley Hall, co. Salop. Morle or Morley, Morle, Norfolk. Pendle. Henry de Penedoke, E. Plank, Essex. Sandford. Scurmy. Segrave. Nicholas de Segrave, A. Thorne. Thornes, co. Salop. Wastness, quartered by Greasley. Wastneys. Sir William Westeney, I. Williams, co. Huntingdon; and Denton, co. Lincoln. Williams.
